channel.title: Website?
channel.description: Erm, thats one odd site. All the text has a font face set instead of just using CSS for it, and it only specifies one font being Microsoft Sans Serif, which is good unless you don't happen to have that font if say you are on a mac or a linux machine, or if you just done have that font installed. My computer shows the font to be Times New Roman. [code]  About me[/code] That's done for every bit of text, and is just a bit ineffcient. This code really doesn't make much sense, it uses % and px for heights and widths not just one or the other.Meh am off to sleep.

item.title: Website?
item.dc:creator: @itendsnow itendsnow
item.description:
@itendsnow wrote:

Erm, thats one odd site. All the text has a font face set instead of just using CSS for it, and it only specifies one font being Microsoft Sans Serif, which is good unless you don’t happen to have that font if say you are on a mac or a linux machine, or if you just done have that font installed. My computer shows the font to be Times New Roman.

<font face="Microsoft Sans Serif" size="2"><b>  <a target="I1" href="about.htm">About me</a></b></font>

That’s done for every bit of text, and is just a bit ineffcient. This code really doesn’t make much sense, it uses % and px for heights and widths not just one or the other.Meh am off to sleep.

Read full topic
